template_data.title: Mire and Mud: Monsters of the Wetlands
template_data.author: [[James Jacobs]]

document_data.caption: Left to right: a gray linnorm, a dread linnorm, and a corpse tearer.
document_data.name: Linnorm
document_data.lifespan: 4,000 years{{Cite dragon/356/The Ecology of the Linnorm|61}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Linnorms''' were a very rare, primeval breed of [[dragon]]-related creatures.{{Cite dragon/182/The Vikings' Dragons|17}}
document_data.Description:
Linnorms had immense bodies that were [[snake]]-like, lacking both wings and rear limbs. Their bodies could grow to be as large as {{SI|70|ft|long=yes}} and weigh as much as {{SI|2|tons|k}}.

These creatures had flexible skeletons, containing hundreds of vertebrae, and grew large trunk muscles that allowed them to dig into the ground with the scales of their underbelly and by pushing forward with their ribs. Their forelegs ended in sharp, razor-like claws.
document_data.Personality:
These creatures were typically known to be cruel, hateful, and very spiteful. They were infamously untrustworthy, rarely honoring bargains.{{Cite dragon/356/The Ecology of the Linnorm|63}}

They were fiercely territorial.{{Cite dragon/356/The Ecology of the Linnorm|62}} Unlike some draconic creatures, not all linnorms were known to be avaricious. The oldest of linnorms typically suffered from some form of insanity due to their isolative nature.
document_data.Abilities:
Much like the more common breeds of dragon, linnorms possessed varying forms of [[dragon breath]]. They also were immune to [[magic]]al effects that induced sleep or paralysis.<ref group="note">In 2nd edition, the non-unique races of linnorm dragons progressed through the usual twelve [[Dragon aging|age categories]] of [[:Category:True dragons|true dragons]].

Linnorms had keen visual senses, possessing both a form of [[blindsight]] and [[darkvision]].
document_data.Combat: When engaging in combat a linnorm relied upon their dragon breath and immense strength, attempting to crush their opponents and swipe them with their tails. Being brilliant tacticians and strategists, linnorms studied their foes from afar and formed plans of attack, made a quick and decisive attack.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
Some believed that all linnorms were the bastard offspring of a legendary, serpent-like creature known as Nidhogg. Other scholars speculated that linnorms originated from [[Niflheim]].

Some scholars believed that linnorms were lesser serpents that evolved from a [[proto-dragon|common ancestor]] of all dragons.{{Cite dragon/356/The Ecology of the Linnorm|60}}

Society.Lairs: These creatures lived inside deep tunnels, which they outfitted with elaborate [[trap]]s.{{Cite dragon/356/The Ecology of the Linnorm|64}}
Society.Homelands: Linnorms infested some of the thinner and lower branches of [[Yggdrasil]], including a [[divine realm]] on its third layer known as the [[Merciful Court]].
Society.Languages: Linnorms typically knew how to speak [[Abyssal language|abyssal]] in addition to [[Draconic language|draconic]].
Society.Relationships: Some acted as [[favored monster|servants]] of the [[deity]] [[Sharindlar]].
Society.Usages: Many scholars and trophy hunters prized their skins, willing to pay up to 12,000 [[gold piece]]s for an intact find.

document_data.Notable Linnorms:
* [[The Hermit]]
* [[Kroth]], a dread linnorm that inhabited the unnumbered layer of [[Layers of the Abyss#Demonwing|Demonwing]] in the [[Abyss]], acting as a guardian of the [[balor]] commander [[Straoth]]'s tower.
